Yes, I would definitely visit this bar again. In fact I plan to check it out soon and hopefully experience it in it's true form. I would like a more chill environment and something tells me that I can expect that from EZ5 on a lighter night. See you soon!
author: alexa c.

description:
I dug this place! Kitchy decor, good tunes, free orange-jell-o shots for Halloween and friendly peeps. Very clean bathroom (my make-it-or-break-it) for a would-be divy bar. 

One con-- who likes soggy olives in their dirty martinis? Yick. Stick to the $3 Sierra for happy hour (lasts 'til 8p!), nosh on the free snacks and let that warm fuzzy beer feeling take over. I'll be dragging my co-workers here for a mid-week happy hour sometime very soon.
author: Jen F.

description:
EZ5 is to me as Cheers is to Norm. Its a bar in an alleyway tucked in between Chinatown and the Financial District. The only reason I know its there is because one of my old college roommates used to party here. The crowd can be hit and miss, but the regulars are great. Ask Bruce about doing the splits. He can't dance, but he can do the splits!

I'm usually sitting at the bar with my homies drinkin', chillin', and building the occasional "tower of tips." More often than not the female bartenders are cute and fun to flirt with. Annie also makes it a point to introduce the new waitresses to me. That gets 5 stars on effort alone! Got to love the "motherly asian lady" stereotype. Kam and Annie always have the place decorated for whatever holiday is coming up and they always have jell-o shots on hand. If you check out the walls you'll also notice that the art work on display, and its always changing too. Classy in a low-key kinda way.

DJ E-Dubb spins on weekends, mostly Fridays now I think. He knows how to throw it back to the 1980s....Cool It Now. More awesome than DJ E-dubb, however, is DJ E-Dubb's mom. She is a regular at the bar. She's fun to hang out with and she can boogie on the dance floor!

If your into totally unprentious dive bars, then this is the place to be. Oh, the lychee martinis are great too. I only drink these when I'm three sheets to the wind. They are super tasty, and its my sign that I've had too much to drink.
author: Kevin Q.

description: Came here on a Thursday around 7pm with a friend...so it was pretty much completely empty. It was okay. I got the yogurt flavored drink, and a rum and cranberry, and it was normal happy hour prices (6-7 per drink). Looks like a family business since the bartender was hanging out with another lady who would just sit there and watch tv/occasionally move around and clean stuff. She carded us when we got in and stared at our ids for a really long time (real id!!) but I guess that's okay since that's what the law says to do. Just weird since I've never really had my ID scrutinized that closely before. Drinks and service overall was okay. Probably the weirdest thing was just when she made my friend's drink, she poured out some of the maraschino cherry juice liquid out of the topping tray into the drink...i don't know if this is the legit way to make the drink, or if she didnt have grenadine.
author: Melody L.

description:
So there I was, wandering around the financial district around 9 on a Saturday night, trying to grab a tasty drink at a fun spot with my homie before taking in the late screening of "Breathless" at the Embarcadero. I know, I know, I'm a pretentious bastard, but please, read on.

Even with my sweet new rectangular piece of technology pointing me to all sorts of spots in walking distance, I couldn't seem to get my ass in a chair and my hand around a glass. Everywhere was closed or fancy, and many places, god forbid, were wine bars. Finally, we decided to ditch the gizmo crutch and follow our gut: we headed up the hill to Chinatown.

Before we knew it,the glow of neon lights poured out onto the otherwise dark sidewalk in front of us. "We're going here," I said. Lucky for us, "here" was the totally sweet EZ 5, Inc. 

I have no interest in seeing what this place looks like in the harsh, unforgiving light of day, but at night it totally pulls off cooshy class. It cracks me up that others have called this a dive. Genteel much? This is in no way a dive, unless you spend your time drinking...in....wine....bars...ohh I get it they're richer than I am.  Annyway. Lighting was low and sohistique, booths were modern yet comfy. Disco ball was a'spinnin. I ordered a silly drink that doesn't have a name and involves pineapple juice and 2 different liquors, and when the bartender got it wrong the first time, he apologized sincerely and happily made me another one, without charging me extra (whicih would have been appropriate, given the price of the ingredient he left out the first time). The place was pretty dead, but it was a little early for a Saturday. I think it would be a blast with a crowd. I'll definitely be back, and with many friends.

Hoping that I don't sound terribly insular, this place was a little bit like walking into a bar in "Lost in Translation." Everything was lovely, but just...different, somehow. Hopefully someone will read this, go there, and agree, so I don't feel like a complete prick. Anyone? No? Not so much?
author: Devin F.

description:
Great place to hold a birthday party.  
I called a few days beforehand, told them I'd be having a party of like 60 people for my birthday, and gave them my name (no deposit or anything).  When I got there, they were so sweet!  The owner is this adorable Chinese woman, and she gave me a huge hug and a present (delicious wine). They had blocked off a table for me, and put balloons on it and everything.  
Everybody got hammered, nobody got kicked out, and the drinks were damn good.
author: Mira B.

description:
First of all, the owner is AWESOME. She looks like someone's mother, not the owner of the one of the coolest bars in the city. When I went here with my coworker, it was pretty crowded and hard to find a seat. We found two chairs and asked her where we could put it. She was like, whatever whatever, anywhere! and she grabbed them and plunked them right down next to the bar. i was like, sweet!

also they have free snacks like egg rolls, salami, chow mein, etc. doesn't seem like you would want to mix them with beer (can you say: beer belly?) but seriously, after a few tall ones you're gonna want something to eat, and it's awesome that they're right there and you don't even have to pay.

we had 4 beers and the damage was only $19. this place is not only cheap but it's got great service!!
author: ting b.

description: my guy friends fancy the hott bartenders, i fancy that it's dark and I can bring my own DJ! I've thrown a couple of parties here with friends and the staff was always laid back. There's a bit of a retro vibe, with their orange couches, and vinyl, but I dig it. The owner even bought us a bottle of champagne for my friend's birthday!
author: Nikki M.

description:
EZ5 is just that, Easy at 5pm, 4pm, 2am... anytime.. It's a tiki gone retro with an asian flair..

Nice cocktails, fun Ms. Pac-Man game and cool sexy house beats...

Hidden down an alley, those who know.. go!
author: Aimee C.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night and it was absolutely empty.  This place feels like you're in a Chinese aquarium.
The bartender was also pretty rude and turned down some random free drink coupon that we had saying they were four years old (if so, why is it still online).  The only good thing about this place is that you can go to Broadway after you walk in and quickly out.
author: Joey S.

description:
EZ5 me please, 
Bowl full of edamame, 
Clean with nice price drinks.
author: Brian J.

description: This should be called the Federal Home Loan Bank of SF "outside" conference room.  You can often find any of a few or more of us playing liars dice and drinking a few suds or cocktails trying to blow off steam from the salt mine of work.  Drinks are reasonable and the service is excellent.  On Friday they have slightly better bar snacks and the DJ is okay enough to be worth it.  You can usually catch a game too on one of the big TVs.
author: Greg R.

description:
I think this is an awesome bar for happy hour. They have pretty good deals and they make an effort to please their clients by giving free food. The food is not great but if you are drunk it does the job. The atmosphere is nice and the bartenders are really friendly. It's in the middle of nowhere also.  
I wonder if this place is open on weekends because Commercial Street and all of financial district area are pretty much empty.
author: Nir B.

description: a hidden bar in the FiDi...granted we went here for our pink slip party so I was already fairly drunk when I arrived.  It was crowded with people and I had a good time.  We had some food and I remember (slightly) that the meatballs were good.  It is all a bit hazy....
author: Katharine A.

description:
When one of my best friend's said she would be having her bday here, I was a bit weary since nobody had heard of the place before. This bar is located on Commercial Street, on a small alley near Chinatown and FIDI. Parking wasn't hard to find at all, since there were no other businesses open at that time of the night on Commercial. 

Surprisingly, this little bar was a cozy haven from the rain that night. It was comfortable, warm, and inviting. There was a DJ spinning hip-hop in the background. It wasn't too loud where you couldn't carry on a conversation...it was just right. Also, the bar was a decent size. It was never difficult to buy a drink, on top of that, the female bartenders were very approachable and friendly. There was always a spot to sit too! What a great place, will be back soon.
author: Anne E.

description: Get some decent beer on tap and maybe I'll come back more often. Thanks.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I don't often go to bars and hardly go to happy hours, but if this is what happy hour is like, sure is fun!

Drinks are cheap and sweet (yum!) 
Waitress is very friendly and remembers what you like to drink (I went there three days in a row...strange circumstances)

The music is hip, the seating is good for groups, and there's free snack bar! (edamame, chips, cheese, pretzels)

Get over the shady alley in which it's located, the cheap looking decor, and you're good to go!

Walk across the street to nearby chinatown for some good eats afterwards!
author: Jane L.

description:
I love this place since it's not too far from work. Great for an after work drink or a random stop on your bar crawl. No cover, there's a DJ and dancing space. Pretty good seating areas. They have their own little drink concoctions and specials. You can watching sports if socializing isn't your thing. I've always had fun when I was here but that's because I was with cool, fun folks. You can stop here and then make your way to the French Quarter bars, if that's your thing.

If Beck still works there (handsome gentleman who looks like Kevin Jonas from the Jonas Brothers), tell him Tatiana sent you. He'll know what it's about.
author: Tatiana D.

description:
I came across EZ5 when a reunion with old HS buddies found us in the only place in SF where we didn't have to wear fancy shoes, wait at a velvet rope, and actually have to YELL OVER the soundsystem.

Being a DJ, I thought it would be a dandy spot to do a couple of gigs and hence my affair with Annie, Kam, and those darned Jell-O shots (if you stay long enough on a given night at EZ, you WILL get Jell-O shots).

So, my first thought was, small, cozy, but possibly hard to fill on a weekend (considering that the location in the FiDi was out of the way and parking may be a lil bit of a challenge). The latter may be a Pro if lounging and enjoying cocktails and chatting up a bit is your tune.

However, for a DJ...I would like the notion of having someone actually listen to some of the records I hauled over from San Jose to SF (yes, I still play vinyl and don't reckon I'll be switching anytime soon). Records are heavy man!

As an audiophile, I feel the soundsystem could get a little more "oomph" in terms of bass, but with residents above the bar and nearby, I understand the need to keep "the peace" (sorta speak).

I dig some of the concoctions they brew (e.g., The Day Off, Barely Legal, 3 Day Weekend) and the staff are personable. Plus, the PacMan table game!

The place is more of a Happy Hour lounge and probably sees more action during the week rather than the weekends.

But what truly makes this joint are the Owners (Annie and Kam).

After my first party (Saturday evening) where we ended having a blast playing until 2:30am (yikes...), all our friends were still up for jammin and decided to go to an after-party at the Gingerbread House (in Potrero) to check out some underground that went until 6~7am (double yikes).

Annie and Kam asked where the place was and I gave em the directions (thinking on how they could possibly ever show up with all the energy spent on their bar that evening).

(flash forward later that next morning at 4am) A friend of mine (while waiting for our drinks at the Gingerbread House) who was at EZ5 earlier asks me, "Hey, aren't those the Owners at the bar you just played at?"- sho nuff, it was Annie and Kam slammin some hefty shots with some friends right there! I joined, we drank, can't say more......?

They're not young but they sure party like Sailors on a 2-day binge!

That's when I fell in love with them and vowed to return to EZ5.
author: Jon S.

description:
If you aren't looking for this bar it's hard to overlook. This bar is good depending on what you're looking for.  If you're in the mood for the "it" spot, this place is definitely not for you.  It is more along the lines of a local bar where people can chill, have a drink and listen to some music.  

I thought the DJ was spinning good music the whole night. I didn't have one complaint in music selection. I thought the drinks were reasonable. (I paid $24 +tip for 4 shots... not cheap but not outrageous) For those that drive, it is easy to find parking which is a big plus in SF (esp if you're like me and have the WORST luck when it comes to finding parking). Ample seating so you can chill with your friends or hang out at the bar. I'd come here again if I wanted to be out but not have a crazy night.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I had a great time at this bar! We went there for happy hour after work one day and I loved it so much I returned later that night!

They had FREE snacks and a good happy hour special.

The bright orange walls added to the already very unique atmosphere. 

This bar was like a breath of fresh air, I totally recommend it if you are looking for something a little different and funky!
author: Rose A.

description:
EZ5 is on a small back alley on Commercial street. If you walk too fast, you'll miss it. 
If your looking for something low key, this place is a cool spot to hit up with your coworkers. Although it does get pretty packed Friday nights. 
I've heard they change it into a small club on Saturdays... I'll have to check it out.
Place is really laid back but could be considered an upscale dive bar. The great thing about this place is that they have Dj's that come in and spin on CDJ's and real vinyl.  
Funny thing is.. Ive run into a few of my college buddys here. Out of all the places in the city to meet... EZ5 was it.
author: Jay P.

description:
EZ5 is by far my favorite neighborhood dive bar! I've had many a good nights and fun memories here, some of which I can't even share with some friends! Drink specials are fairly priced but tend to be on the sweet side, which means it's easy to accidentally get buzzed.

Make sure to chat up mama Annie behind the bar... if you're so inclined, you can even sigh up on her mailing list and get spam (i mean updates) on upcoming parties and events at the bar!
author: Andrey C.

description: For an after-work drink, this place fits the bill.  I don't know that I'd exactly want to spend a whole lot of time here, but the $3 sierra pints were good and cold, the free pot stickers homemade (would have liked some soy sauce, though) and it was pretty chill versus most Friday after work spots that are a bit too packed sometimes.  DJ was a non-entity as I barely noticed.  Pretty dark inside on a bright sunny day.  I agree with others that the decor and ambiance is a bit odd, but that's just SF's compactness and intermingling of neighborhoods in action .
author: Marc S.

description:
First off, thanks for the sets with DJ BENdover. Sure, that's not his actual name, but that's how we roll. But stop giving him monday night sets! Well, actually, keep him on mondays because we get the more intimate setting since hardly a soul stops in. But give him some fridays so we can get the poppin joint, too.

DJ Bendover brought me in here. Otherwise I never would have found the place. Parking isn't an issue. Street parking all around after business hours. 

Drinks are cheap and the bartender is friendly and cute.

Did I mention DJ Bendover? I'm not biased.

ps bonus for a clean bathroom.
author: MiYong E.

description:
This place is a favorite of Wells Fargo employees. I've been to this place a number of times with various Wells Fargo co-workers, and I like this place.  

What's great is that they serve free food for Friday happy hour!  Do you know of any other happy hour in the city that does that?  And the food is good too! They always have trays of Chinese food (fried rice, dumplings, egg rolls, etc.,) and chips and cookies too!  The drink specials are so-so, but they wait staff is so nice and funny, you don't even care.
author: James C.

description:
This is such a fun place. My girlfriend had a bunch of friends in town from all over the place to attend a wedding, and we needed somewhere to go unwind after the wedding at around midnight. Clearly a fancy club was the last thing anyone wanted. So we took her friends here. $20 for 20 jello shots. Score. Ms. Pac Man and Galaga machine. Score.

The old Asian lady (I think she's the owner?) is also really nice.
author: Steve C.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night at the behest of a friend who had other peeps to meet there. A bit of a young crowd, so maybe that's why the drinks were DAMN weak!

I know I'm a professional drinker and all, but it usually doesn't take me six crown & cokes to get a buzz on.
author: Priya S.

description:
OK, this bar gets a 3-star rating mainly because it's a dive that has managed to rebel against the expectations of its upbringing, the Financial District. And around these parts, that's no easy task given the number of totally lame and average bars that cater to their equally lame and average clientele. So EZ5 doesn't have a pool table or jukebox but neither do dive bars in Asia; they're just dark and suspect places usually tucked away in some unassuming alleyway... just like EZ5! 

Speaking of Asia, every time I've been in here, I've never quite been able to shake off the feeling that EZ5 is actually a front for an illegal massage parlour operation. I mean, there's even a madam-like figure here who doubles as a bartender. Perhaps the complimentary hors d'oeuvres are intended to keep you around long enough to drink yourself stupid, at which point, all the scantily-clad ladies scurry out to pair up with potential male patrons and lure them into the back room? I guess what I'm trying to say is, happy-hour wise, EZ5 totally beats the Irish Bank and its top-siders-sans-socks-wearing crowd.
author: Jenn W.

description:
All I got to say is the best hole in a wall lounge bar in SF that I've ever been to. Really laid back and even for the size it wasn't too crowded.

I must've bought over a good $145 on alcohol which was a suprise when I had seen my reciepts in my pocket in the am, but it could have been worst since the prices were very reasonable.

Lychee Martini is a must.

We went there for my boy Ed's bday last friday is it was just an awesome experience.
author: Gerard L.

description:
Oh my God!! Annie is the best!!
Every year my doctor ask me,.."how often do you drink?" I would always starred and think really hard for 3 minutes... "hmm..  1 drink every 3 months..maybe?"   This year when I go to my doctor, I hope she doesn't freak out if I have to tell her that I go to bars on weekly basis now.

I thank EZ5 and I'm a better person for it!
author: N. C.

description:
mehhh....  a bit seedy if you ask me.

My friends used to DJ here on Wednesdays and I've joined them on the decks a few times.  

Kinda empty, kinda not very nice.  Friendly staff though!
author: Adrian L.

description:
I might be biased since this is really close to home and my Friday evening go-to bar, but I have had a good time every time I've been there.  

To be fair, this is not an upscale bar by any means.  However, the vibe is friendly and welcoming for almost anyone no matter how you are dressed.  They have finger foods in the back, and a couple of couches for groups to congregate. Their sangrias - however cheaply made, are actually not bad.  I never had to wait long for service.
author: Amy L.

description:
Maybe I need to go on another night but, all I saw at EZ5 were a bunch of little Asian kids, all apparently UC Berkeley students who decided Spring Break is better spent in a tiny, cheesy orange-colored bar with a handwritten chalkboard sign outside the door that reads, "EZ5!  No cover!  Drink specials!"  What is this, a pizza parlor?  Could they not afford a better medium to advertise?

Maybe I'll perform an experiment - select a random night to attend and confirm if the crowd remains the same.  

Maybe not.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Everytime I come here, I wonder how everyone finds this place.  It's tucked in an alley in Chinatown, pretty close to Portsmouth Square.   There is pretty much nothing else going on in the area so kudos to EZ5 for getting their name out there or having returning clientele.

First off, this place is SMALL.  I can probably take 20 steps from front door to the back, where the bathroom is.  Fortunately it's pretty lively for an intimate spot and the DJ isn't bad. Everytime I've come here it's never been totally dead or totally packed.  It's always decently filled and comfortable enough for you and your buddies to chat. There are a bunch comfy chairs and seating with mood lighting in full effect.  There's also a Galaga machine in the bar, which gives it more points!!!  I had top score at work until some bastard beat it at work....

The bar is tended pretty well as I have never waited too long for a drink.  Prices are about average, probably 4-5 $ for a beer and 7-8$ for a mixed drink.  They give you snacks to munch so that's a definitely plus.  

There's no dress code or cover so that's always a plus.  I hate bars/clubs that charge you coin and when you walk in there's no one in there.  Sucks!!  I don't go out much so I can't comment which ones do that....

Overall it's a pleasurable experience everytime I came here so it gets an A-OK from me.
author: Jason Y.

description: weekend late night past eleven...commercial street alley location...near meeting of financial, north beach and chinatown...eclectic and colorful...casual, friendly and good vibes all throughout...bartender servicing quick and efficient...great easy atmosphere....an "everyday bar"....guinness on tap for self...individual mini-champagne bottle and glass for other...sip irish stout...game of galaga and ms. pac-man...other mingle, chat and socialize...plenty of action for both...
author: Hen A.

description:
Well, i go here after a long day at the office to unwind.  Friday's are great because they have free happy hour snacks.  Kind of a dive, but urban cool with eclectic surroundings.  A little mid century in an orange bubble.

They always have music.  Wed & Friday a dj spinning 80's-90's R&B, Pop and Hip Hop.  You will be down wit da 5!
author: erica u.

description:
I went to a Funcheap party here with a friend on Thursday from 6 - 8 pm and loved it. It was crowded but you could still stand in a group and talk without getting jabbed in the ribs and back. They have couches to lounge on and an interesting bar to sit at. I plan on checking this place out again after work. The staff was nice a quick to pick up you empty glass. The greatest part was that there was never a line for the bathroom.

The people were really friendly. Hope no one missed their flight :)
author: E P.

description:
This is my kind of place! It has so much charm and character! Great and really cozy atmosphere! I've been here twice now- last night and last week; both on a Monday night.

It was a friend's birthday last night, so we grabbed a couple other people and came out here to have a few drinks. We sat in the lounge area and were greeted by Edgar, who brought us our drinks, a dish of complimentary snacks (that included a mix of peanuts, pretzels, corn nuts, and Goldfish crackers), and a pack of cards and some dice, explaining to us some drinking games that we could play.

They were more than kind and extremely generous; they even gave us a round on the house! And everybody traded hugs & kisses with Mama, who's one of the owners; a fantastic woman who kept us all entertained with her lively, histrionic personality. Needless to say, we had  a blast! We're going to grab a couple more friends and come out to their 4th anniversary next Saturday on the 8th of September!

And the best part (for me, anyways) is that I live right around the corner, so after a night of fun here I only have to take a few steps and I'm home!
author: P A U L.

description:
I usually end up here because my friend DJ's on several occasions. It's almost like a small blackhole. How a tiny little spot can get you so hammered is hilarious.

Their drinks are stiff and cheap, so with a blink of an eye....you're having a great time.

Definitely come here with a few people, as it's a cool spot to lounge and chill.
author: Anne K.

description: I was her on a Monday night and somehow was talked into singing karaoke. Amazing karaoke video, very friendly owner, jello shots, probably more lively on an acceptable drinking night.
author: Scoot S.

description: I love this place... service is great... love the sexy cute bartenders... super friendly.  Drinks are never watered down.  Definitely will come here again.
author: Tom C.

description:
This bar is by my job and it's got a chill decor to it and best of all they have a DJ spinning from Happy Hour to bar closing. They also have two flat screen TVs along with an old school Pac-Man/Galaga arcade table (good for resting beers on). 

The crowd is a mixture of what you would expect on the borderline of the Financial District and China Town. Some nights are busy and some nights are slow motion. The drink costs are average, but the bartenders (who will often drink too), bouncers (they're funny), and DJs are some chill people. 

This place is one of my favorite bars to go to with my friends when we want to chill and listen to all kinds of music from house to rap. This bar is also a great place to go to before you pursue any other plans for your weekend/weekday night.

Overall, EZ5 is a cool place to chill and unwind : )
author: C G.

description:
This is a fun place for a small group of friends, or for happy hour.

You'll find the usual FiDi crowd here. The -free- happy hour snack and the cozy atmosphere give you the feeling that you're at a friends place just hanging out.  If you arrive in a slightly larger group, one of the owners will gladly re-arrange the furniture to accommodate.

The martini drink  are good for $7-$10

Good 3 Stars!
author: Shea G.

description:
A best kept secret in a hidden FIDI alleyway?
Meh, it a hip hop sports bar is your thang maybe
you can deal, but this estab isn't bad for a happy hour just after
work watering hole, especially on fridays where they roll out a 
complimentary snacks mainly edamame (sp?) and a few other
gnoshibles. The place is small and crowded and possibly overstaffed? WTF? It's clean though, that's why i give 3 stars.
author: wayne s.

description:
bartenders are sweet and knows how to pour but everytime i come here they're being yelled by the owners. i don't really know the asian lady owner and the dude (husband?), but i don't appreciate owners treating their employees like trash. 

they really fit that stereotype of asian bar owners being stingy and shady. i will not support owners like these.
author: Yelp-alholic T.

description:
After running into Cam and Annie a few times, and hearing about EZ5, I felt it was my time to visit. I was very happy that I did. To start things off, for me, the location is killer. Being located in an alley, off of the main street, has a perfect feel to it. Was welcomed by Cam at the door, who was taking a break, and proceeded to step into a great atmosphere. The DJ music was moving, and along with the rest of the setting, gave me the impression that "I WANT TO DRINK HERE!!!!" 

The bartender was a slender cute girl named Yen. She asked what I wanted, and I said something with pineapple juice, her choice. Yen returned with a very tasty drink, that hit the spot. I can't remember the name of the drink, because I was already too drunk, LOL!!! I followed that with a shot of Jack over, to toast with a drink I purchased for Annie. 

EZ5 is now added to my list of places to visit. I was told that it becomes a club on Friday and Saturday. There is also a happy hour that I want to check out.

Bonus: The Patron  machines is a nice touch. The bathroom is clean. Flat screen TV had the game on.
author: Mike T.

description: Meh.  Not terrible.  I remember going in here many many years ago for some kind of dot-com launch party.  I thought it was kind of odd inside then, but I wasn't really sure if that was an aspect of the bar or something to do with the madness of dotcom style decor...  So, apparently, now that I've gone back and seen it again, it really is just part of the way the bar is supposed to be.  Interesting at least, I guess.
author: Mason G.

description: EZ5 is a great bar for local patrons in the outskirts of Chinatown. It has a very comfortable atmosphere, where people can go and feel like they've been there forever. With a great regular staff and customers, EZ5 makes happy hour easy for you! Plus, the owners there are very personable and easy to make friends with. They often pour drinks and serve snacks for you. With great music and an ambiance that can be both crowdedly festive or loungey relaxing, EZ5 is as easy as 1-2-3.....4-5!
author: Nathaniel J.

description: It's ok.  The staff isn't too friendly and they aren't very fast at getting you drinks either. It's also $4 for a bud light.  I do, however enjoy the hideous orange couches and yellow walls.  It's pretty sweet. It's always fun when DJ PK  spins the music too.  It's also pretty convenient considering it's like two blocks from my office.
author: Jenny W.

description: one of my favorites bar. Annie and staffs are very nice and kind. Nice Atmosphere. Good for group/privet party (small place). I found my memory here (the picture broad) - the time I start dating my husband, that was back to 2005. We still going back from time to time.
author: Regina L.

description: I come here for the grilled saba and pickled vegetables.
author: Wakako U.

description: Something between a random chinatown dive and a normal lower nob hill dive. Good atmosphere, great people, and cheap drinks. Works for me.
author: Monika M.

description: Tucked into Commercial in between Chinatown and the Financial District, nights at EZ5 can be described with one word: unpredictable. You either can have the best night of your damn life here or wish you were at home watching Elimidate reruns, and it all depends on the intangibles (the group you came with to lounge on the beanbags on, the crowd which widely fluctuates night to night, and the music, which is almost always bad but when intoxicated, becomes mere background noise to the current hilarity.)
author: Ramon T.

description:
Hidden Gem down commercial street..a block away from the hustle and bustle of the border between Chinatown and North Beach's italian "HOOD"

I just dropped by for a friendly sat get together and what was supposed to be a small gathering, turned into a huge get together for former High School Alumni people. 

I ran into friends...friends of friends...siblings of friends...wives of friends...etc etc.

What I also noticed?  People looked a LOT shorter than I remember =)

I remember some girls I met back then who seemed to be like 5'5" tall..were more like 5" tall.   Man..maybe my impression of them was overinflated....must've been.

Okay..back to EZ5.   

Very strong drinks for a very reasonable price.  Very attractive bartender who was friendly to everyone.   The place is COZY..it's about the size of a large condo...but it definitely fills up.  

The DJ was playing my favorite blend of 70s, 80s, 90s Daly City variety, freestyle, hip hop fare.

I recommend this place for any planned get togethers or small relaxed gatherings.  Yes there is dancing...and NO COVER!
author: Michael L.

description: Went here with a friend on a whim and ended up having a pretty fun night. I love little divey bars.  We left pretty drunk and I think I only spent $20.
author: Kiki A.

description: I'm not savvy when it comes to writing reviews, but EZ5 is a truly special place! Great people, Fun environment, and the owners are sweet people who are always there.
author: Josh G.

description:
This was my first time ever visiting this place. Had it not been for the Happy Hour function we had today, I probably would have never found it. After my experience today I wish I hadn't. There isn't too much to this story, but what coincided left me completely flabbergasted. 

I had just finished a typical day at work and headed to EZ5 to meet up with some coworkers for drinks. I really wasn't in the mood for alcohol so I ordered some water finishing my first glass rather quickly. When I asked for a second glass, an annoyed bartender told me that this would be my last free glass, and if I wanted more water I'd have to pay for it. ARE YOU SERIOUS? I need to pay for tap water? Worst part of it all was that this person turned out to be "Momma" who apparently is an owner if not THE owner.

Of the 100s of bars that I have visited across the globe, never have I experience anything like this. What was this lady thinking? I was with a group of 20+ regular customers who were also in shock by this story. I can't even think of ANY situation where it would be ok to deny somebody water. I was feeling very dehydrated so was not in the mood for any alcohol and for the OWNER of a bar to deny me from something I needed because "it does not make good business sense" is simply outrageous. Apparently she needs to pay her water bill. Funny thing is I heard that Momma sometimes hands out free shots. 

Well, I guess if you're looking for a bar where you can get really wasted without having to worry about your friends calling you a wuss for pacing your drinking with water then EZ5 is the bar for you. Well, now that I got that off of my chest, I'm gonna go get my water. 

Oh, and Momma, you should probably rethink the strategy of denying water to your customers. Someday you'll realize that it actually IS good for business.
author: Marcel I.

description: I like this place. It's a total dive bar sorta in between the financial district and Chinatown - it is on Commerical below Kearny. Came on a Monday and it was really empty. Liked how they gave peanuts and pretzels, which are fun to throw at people. They also have a list of cocktails that are included in the happy hour special. I had a French Kiss aka...the french martini. It was good and like either only $6 of $7.
author: Natalie S.

description:
3.5 stars.  definite improvement.

hayley w. and i happy hour'd this past monday.  not a lot of people there at all, which we didn't mind anyway b/c we always provide more than enough entertainment for ourselves.  

the first couple of drinks were pretty weak, but annie took over and blessed us w/a pretty heavy hand.

the music still gets me grinding in my seat, which is always a good sign.
author: Ting A.

description:
i was here a few years ago for a villains' holiday party. i had a great time. and then totally forgot about this bar.

fast forward to about two weeks ago when i was back at EZ5 for a friend's birthday party. as soon as i turned the corner to EZ5's little alley i remembered i had been here before. nothing too special about the place: bar - beers - dj - all check.

not a bad place to end up if you're in the neighborhood, but i wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: This place is so cool! I love that it's sort of FiDi but not your typical Royal Exchange or some other lame yuppie bar. The ambiance is kind trippy and they have free food. Plus the dj played some awesome tunes when we were there. Best of all when I went it wasn't crowded. I would love to come back here with a group.
author: Cathy T.

description:
the most awesome thing by far about ez5 is that you can just call them and be like "can i have my birthday party in your bar?  i have djs!"  and they'll say sure and tell you to get at least 100 people but it doesn't matter that much if you don't get 100 people.  and yes, they'll keep it open to the public, but not much of the public will be there anyhow, but who cares anyway cause for free you and your friends get to be in charge of the music for dance dance fun.   and it's a cute space with nice seating and good spots to pass out in if you get too drunk.

thank you ez5!
author: Sharon M.

description: This is my local "after work don't know where else to go" bar. It's dark, retro interior, cool enough hang out. They have great drinks and provide appetizers too. It can get pretty packed though, tiny space. I've never been there except on an after work happy hour though so I can't vouch for it's party night viability. It's chill...that's it.
author: Cassy R.

description:
on cinco de mayo the friendly bartenders here served up a special of $3 tequilas. 

i wonder what other kinds of awesome deals this little bar has got up its sleeves on normal days.
author: Andrew P.

description: First time I checked this out was on Saturday for a friend's birthday. Never been to this place before, so did not know what to expect. Was pleasantly surprised by it despite the look of place from the outside. The neighborhood it is in is the FiDi, so there are not a ton of other venues around here until you walk west towards Chinatown. The cocktail selection was pretty nice-they had Hendrick's so I am happy with the booze. The bartender did mess up my order at least twice in the evening, but the service was quick. Not a bad place to go to if you don't have a lot of other options but you won't be disappointed. Music was provided by friends so not sure what kind of music usually goes on there on a typical evening.
author: Hans H.

description: I only come here when my friends are DJ'ing.  I have some good memories in this bar.  It's a small place, but big enough to dance.  It's nearby Chinatown, so right after when the bar closes you can get some good eats.
author: Annie S.

description:
its dark, cozy, tucked away in an alley by my office .... and the drinks ... strong and cheap.  its dive bar meets quiet chic.  we get great service and this is the only place i can be coerced into many jello shots.  they tend to be on the house.  nice.

this is the kinda place where I don't have to worry about seeing anyone that I don't want to see ... my hood, my bar, that's that.

also an excellent place for a girl to watch a ball game without interruption by girl-hungry boys.
author: Sarah K.

description: Cheap drinks and a great atmosphere of a dive with the right amounts of uncleanliness but still homely. Friday happy hours till 8pm... what?! Just make sure if you order mixed drinks that they know exactly what's suppose to be in it 'cause you might just get something with a strange ass asian herb medicine liquor in it!
author: Gil A.

description:
this makes a great getaway if you work in yuppy-town (aka the Financial District).  sometimes you want to get a drink after work and head elsewhere and not too far away.  the bartenders have always been great to us and Mama is just the best!

it does get a little empty, but when it picks up, it picks up.  overall, the place is comfy and welcoming.  not at all pretentious.
author: Anthony R.

description: I haven't been in a few years, but I used to work/live around the corner from EZ 5 and it was my place back then.  Cam (or Kim, never got that one sorted) and Annie, the owners, are great, great people.  This could be urban legend, but I heard that Cam (or Kim) drives a school bus during the day to help support the bar (his lifelong dream).  They are like a couple of proud parents with that place - where the poppa mixes a mean martini and the momma serves up a tray of appetizers and then drinks you under the table... Yes, to crib off another poster, the decor is circa-70's cheesy kung fu movie, but how cool is that?  I can only take the Marina scene in small (and very, very wet) doses.  C'mon people, they've got Pac Man!!!
author: Meghan H.

description: This little pretty hole is perfect for post work drinks. Nicely decorated on the inside and easy to miss on the outside, this little spot has free snacks and resonably priced drinks. A good hang out that's not too crowded, music's not too loud, and the drinks aren't too watered down.
author: benjamin c.

description: Upgrading to 3 stars.  I think one of the bartenders here has a crush on me.  I will happily fall under that illusion.
author: Kyle K.

description:
pretty cool interior with comfortable seating options like sofas and bean bags.   usually have some reasonable tunes supplied by a dj on the weekends.  

however, if you are looking to party, you better bring your own, because this place is always empty.
author: eric g.

description: I've only been here once, but once was enough.  It has the potential to be a great divey bar. The decor is certainly eclectic-- you feel like you're in someone's basement from the 80s-- but unlike a good dive bar, the drinks here were weak. The friends I was with actually had the bartender supplement their drinks with more liquor after they tasted them!
author: shoba d.

description: One of Cal's good friends is a regular here, and he invited us to ring in the new year with him. I invited my friends and it was the best NYE ever! It's intimate, the music's good, the drinks are strong. And the Jello shots are great. I am not at all embarrassed to say that I still love Jello shots! We came back to celebrate Cal's friend's birthday a couple of months ago. It was a black and white party, and everyone, including the staff took part in it. Always a fun time at EZ5!
author: Mary T.

description: This is a small little place, but its pretty neat. Stools at the bar and then basically a lounge area. A small, but decent sized dance floor for a small little place like this. I dislike the fact that some of them start being extremely rude by 1:40, kicking everybody out and telling people who just bought a drink to hurry up. But I do like the Chinese lady that probably owns the place who gets down and shakes it every now and then. I do like the fact that theres a DJ spinning music but no cover.
author: Elaine H.

description: Came here last night with some friends and had a pretty good time!  I'll admit, I was really skeptical when I saw that it was located in a Chinatown alleyway, but it was pretty clean, cozy and borderline tacky inside (perfect!).  Cocktails were $7 and very sweet, not a bad thing in my book.  I was afraid they'd be too wimpy because most of them were mainly Malibu and juice, but I think they had some potential.  The only annoying thing is that they have a $20 minimum to pay by credit card.
author: Krystle S.

description: The best hole-in-the-wall dive bar int he financial district - although some may say it's in Chinatown. Be sure to say hi to "Momma" when you go!
author: Lisa H.

description: Very odd crowd and I honestly couldn't figure it out. The DJ was decent, playing mostly familiar tunes. The free appetizers were a nice option, but chillingly cold. I was so hungry at the time that I actually ate some of the "spring rolls" and "chicken wings". Drink specials were nothing special, $1 off...
author: Nicolas H.

description: This is where my co-workers hang out most happy hours. I don't really get it myself. It's a dive bar, with cheezy mood lighting, and nothing more. They do play better music than a dive bar; Mostly house/lounge music. They have free appetizers, but none of it is really appealing. It's a great place to have a few drinks if you don't give a sh** about ambiance.
author: Megan D.

description:
Went here on Friday with some peeps I work with.  I went in there and was surprised it wasnt a gay bar with all of the corny decorations like excessive streamers and disco balls etc.  
I saw girls in there and was pleased beyond belief.  The seating was really comfortable and the sierra nevada's were only three bucks!  The appy's were pretty nasty and I was stuck talking to a 50 year old women for like an hour.  Then I was cornered into a conversation with a former meth head who eventually found Jesus.  
Three stars for the three dollar sierras.
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description:
You know, I've been going to this place for years.  Always feels so chill in there.  Such a great place to lounge, bullshit with your friends, and have a few drinks in.

First off, no cover.  I mean every single review said it so I figured I might as well just say it too.  (Maybe it was a prerequisite?)  You walk in and automatically are at the other side of the bar.  It's an exaggeration of course but it's a pretty tiny little spot.  Good thing though that it's in the cuts and isn't the most crowded of spots, as long as there isn't multiple birthdays going on!

Bartenders are nice, drinks are moderately priced as well.  You'll usually see Kam (owner dude I believe) over there and he's a helluva nice guy.  

I wanted to have at least 4 "paragraphs" for this review so here's another one.  Nice seats, comfy little couches and cushioned chairs.  Good stuff.  They have an old school table top Ms. Pac-Man machine.  I'm pretty sure it also has Galaga too.  (Galaga's fun)

Overall, I like the place.  Not too overwhelming and you can just grab a few friends and hang out while having a few drinks!  But I suggest asking them politely rather than grabbing them, people can be so touchy these days.  (Not the good touchy either)
author: Dan Anthony A.

description: Surprisingly nice staff, $3 pints of Sierra (and other beers I think) during happy hour as well as free bar munchies.  It has a great bar vibe and is perfectly situated for happy hour.  Lots of seating, but did fill up pretty quickly after work.  Nice little hidden gem on the border of the FiDi and Chinatown.
author: Corey V.

description: Learn how to make some drinks will ya? The sever shouldn't have to come back to me 3 times to ask how to make a manhattan. And what's with the little white bread sandwiches and stale chips?
author: N B.

description: The one time I went, my friends and I were the only people there.  I thought it might just be because it was a Wednesday or something, but even on a weekend I peeked in and it was empty.  The woman behind the bar didn't know how to make some simple drink my friend ordered--I think it was a white russian or something like that.
author: Gina K.

description: Wow the reviews are harsh!  I like this place.  The interior decorating is a bit odd, but just try not too hard to think about it.  But it's a great place for Friday happy hour.  My office is around the corner and my co-workers are usuals.  They always have a great dj spinning hot beats on Friday with free munchie food like chicken wings, egg rolls, quiches and other goodies.  I highly recommend the lychee martini, the best one I have had yet.  Check it out.
author: Jessica C.

description:
let me start by saying LYCHEE MARTINI! oh so delicious! :D 

this place is pretty saaaaweeet! the drinks are reasonably priced and the vibe is pretty chill. this is a great place to hang out after a long day at work. there's no cover and the music is pretty cool. they even offer free snackies! YAY!
author: Kristin Y.

description: A truly fun, unpretentious dj bar tucked away in the Financial District... some of the best music nights I've been to in sometime... very fun crowd, they have a fun happy hour too.
author: April M.

description:
ready to get your drink on?  only focused on getting some alcohol in your system?  don't care about ambiance, atmosphere, the crowd (or lack thereof)?  trying to avoid the supercrowded, super snooty bougie ultralounges that are popping up like starbucks all over the city?  this is your spot.

on a mission to drown our work-related sorrows, coworkers and i checked out this joint on a tuesday evening.  walked in and squinted as our eyes adjusted to the dim lighting - hmmm, a few people at the bar...and empty seats.  not crowded at all. after a few rounds of single-malt scotch, mission accomplished - good enough buzz to forget about work, even if just for a moment.  we weren't offered any happy hour bites mentioned in the other reviews - did we come on an off night? - but soaked up some alcohol with the peanut mix, and noticed a happy hour special of jello shots...umm...yeah, i'll stick to the macallan, thank you very much.
author: Jen P.

description: Entertaining Dj with a 'stache.  Vintage Pac man/Galaga sit down game, circa 1987 Pizza Hut.  Free food, with such interesting combinations as caramel cube and celery stalk and cheetos(seriously).  Furniture so unhip its hip.  Total dive, but very friendly, not expensive, great location, good crowd most times i have been, and some unique items worth coming back for.
author: Christian W.

description: This was a pretty fun bar, very relaxed atmosphere and no cover. The music was good but no one was dancing because it's pretty small and there was no room for gettin down. I'm not sure why the location on here says it's located in the financial district because I feel like it's in the middle of Chinatown. We found street parking around the corner, so that, combined with the lack of cover, was a guarantee for a good night.
author: Sobrina T.

description: Review: weekend 9pm+. Hasn't been the "happening" scene lately.  If you're looking for a chill night w/music, head here. The one reason I come is cuz the bartend-ress, Denise is awesome!  I don't have to wait long to get my drink order, and she makes the perfect drink everytime!  Otherwise, most nights, it'll be pretty quiet w/the occasional bachelor & bachelorette parties which can take up 50% of the space.
author: Christi S.

description: Me likes. 4 stars like. Inexpensive drinks. DJ was effin' good. Pretty cool group of ppl. Place is small so there's basically no dance floor (that's where the minus star comes in), though once you're tipsy the spot where you stand becomes your dance floor :) Oh yeah...
author: Marlene T.

description: This is handsdown one of my favorite bars because it is so hard to define. All of the reviewers so far are right. Yes, it's over 40 people, and yes, it's under 25 people, and yes, it has funky mismatched furniture and cheap doo-dads, and yes, the owners are nice. They were having really good hors d'oevres for a while, and the DJs were OK if old school, 90s hip hop, and electronica were your bit. It's small and next to my fave dim sum place. It's random and eccentric like SF, and yay, it's not in the Mission!
author: Anna B.

description: Everytime I think of EZ5 I think of good happy hour times.  Sure the place is kinda small and the decor is retro, but the staff is super duper friendly and they have a nice little appetizer bar to fill up your stomach before drinking it up with your fellow co-workers.  Be sure to get there early on a Friday though because this place gets packed with the Financial District happy hour crowd.
author: Yun W.

description: I used to work here as a bartender many years ago.  I loved this place because it was totally hidden, they played music, the owners were so chill (not like most bar owners) and they came up with different types of drinks for happy hour.  They're pretty chill...it's dark, and the ambiance is nice.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it's small as hell inside.
author: Nathalie C.

description: I threw my bf a surprise bday party here.  The venue is awesome because it's not too big and not too small.  We pretty much filled the entire place with our friends. Great street parking, reasonably priced drinks, Live dj, free apps, bday cake...can't beat it!
author: T D.

description:
4th saturday's of every month, my buddy (JaySlim) dj's here.  for that fact alone, it gets a 5.  actually, b/c they also have a sit down pacman 2 player arcade game, that earns a 5 as well.  quality of bar, it's probably a 3.  the drinks are on the pricier side, considering it is a dive bar, and a reallllly divey bar at that.

if we even that out, it's a 4.  staff is usually pretty friendly, though they've been having some annoying waitresses recently that just turn me off so much that i'd rather order at the bar instead.
author: Jason J.

description: I'm probably only giving this place 4 stars bc I was drunk already when I got there.  The drunker I am, the more likely I am to be enjoying myself.  Would I enjoy this place sober?  I don't care to find out.
author: Katie H.

description: EZ 5 is a great after work financial disctict boozer location. Its pretty dark but the peeps that work there are great and tend to feed you free finger foods on select evenings! Often good DJs (hehe KIMON!) that get me groovin. Fancy lights on the wall but...I am sad to see the sit down PacMan go away! :(
author: Inome C.

description:
This place is pretty good to get wasted or to nurse a beer with some fellow co-workers after a day's work.. The drinks are reasonably priced and best of all they have free food!  The happy hour drinks taste pretty good but I'm more of a beer person.  The waitresses are all very nice and hot by the way.  
They just need work on the space, the place is a little cramped.
author: Ethan C.

description: Not a bad bar to go to in chinatown. Good music good drinks. It wasnt the most poppin place the night I went but still descent.
author: alex h.

description: Great hidden spot in the Chi-nancial District. Always a good time here.... especially on the 1st Saturday of the month... good drinks, great music, friendly staff and NO COVER! My favorite low-key, debauchery filled spot in SF.
author: Mike A.

description: staffs are nice, drinks are reasonable, above all, occasional free dinners and drinks from mama (owner). love it!
author: Hsan H.

description: I have been here once...and I dont know about the rest of the reviews but i thought this place was kinda ghetto and shady.  Try at your own risk in the middle of this dark alley.
author: Charles C.

description: I like EZ5.  It's dark and cozy with good music that isn't blasting loud.  I've never seen it really packed except for during a FunCheap event last year - which was a lot of fun.  It's a nice and relaxing place to go after work if you're in the FiDi or Chinatown area.
author: Sara H.

description:
Grrrrr8t happy hour hang out.  Its a hole in the wall, you'll walk right pass it if you're not paying attention.  EZ5 is actually a hike uphill from where I work (California /Davis) but its worth the walk.  

They have cute booth seats with square/foot rest add-ons that can be moved around depending on how big or small your group is and they have $3 Sierra....whoa!  Other HH specials include $3 wine but mind you, its $3 so don't expect much.  I'm not a wine drinker myself but just looking out for those of you who are.  Jello shots are only $1 if you're feeling adventorous.  The place also has complementary snacks, not just mixed nuts but salami, pretzels, edamame and other stuff.  Service is awesome,  the girls are on top of their stuff.  No need to do any hands in the air signals to get another drink.

EZ5 is the place I go to for a chill time to hang out after work.
author: Arceny A.

description: Happy Hour is when i've been.  Reasonable prices, a plasma usually showing sports, sometimes they have free snacks, random selection of chairs and seating, but it works; sometimes they have a DJ.  Once went to a comedy show here which was bad.  Good, local, get a couple drinks and chat with friends then move on type of place.
author: Smilingspiders C.

description: 5 Greats: price on drinks, close to restaurants, near public transportation, self-serve bar snacks, jello shots. I know, the jello shot thing had my pal shocked, so we had to buy some =)
author: Star B.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! My favorite bar in the whole city. Great service, awesome DJ's and very pretty woman behind the bar and in the bar. This is the "CHEERS" of SF. You want a place to party with good friends, then this is the place the be!!!
author: Allan F.

description: this has got to be one of the strangest little bars, but i had fun there. it decor is really bizarre, like along the lines of rickshap stop but better. the people i was with were great so we had a nice time but the bartender was terrible. slightly rude and couldn't make a drink to save his life.
author: Michelle I.

description: This place used to be fun when this really cool guy named T. owned it. All the hipster kids would come out and it was a real scene...made me happy that I lived in SF. Photo booth, good music, adorable bartenders, great drinks and AWAY FROM THE MISSION (imagine that!) but then it all changed.   I guess the landlords weren't stoked when they realized that T. was making all the money...they gouged the rent and made him sell the bar. Now it's this BIZARRE Chinatown-Financial District hangout where the people aren't friendly and the drinks SUCK. Bad news bears is what I say.
author: Megan K.

description: had a pretty goood time here fora TGIF happy. they had some weird finger foods but food is always good when  youre drinking mixed drinks. those frame pictures of asian girls wearing sars masks creep me out tho.good crowd
author: Farajaqua S.

description: tucked away in a tiny alley between chinatown and the financial district, i never would've noticed its little red neon sign if it hadn't been pointed out to me.  the first thing i saw when i walked thru the door was one of those red HAND chairs!  you know, like the one evie had in her room on 'out of this world'.  i had to go sit in it and try to stop time by pressing the tips of my fingers together.  disappointed that it didn't work, i joined my friends at the bar.  the bartender served up stiff drinks all around and then whipped out a box of grapes to share!  strong libations AND fresh fruit?  i'm sold.
author: lanlian s.

description: Nice place to hit up if you want to get out of the craziness of the SF club scene. Parking was surprisingly easy to find. When I got out of my car and saw the place was just around the corner, I was like "Oh snap!" My cousin and I arrived just after 10, so most of the clientele was at the bar. We grabbed a seat on one of the couches and placed the first of many drink orders for the night with the waitress. She reminded me of Gogo from Kill Bill with her slow pacing back and forth. Hey, she could've been hiding a meteor hammer somewhere in that hoodie she was wearing! All assumptions aside, she was actually very nice and attentive. A friend of ours was the DJ that night. He dished out mostly 80s and 90s joints, and I don't recall hearing anything mainstream, which was cool. More people began filling the place up after 11, but not to the point where it was hard to weave through the crowd. Overall, the vibe was good and the drinks hit at the right moment. No complaints here! I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Rhia R.

description: i like this place alot! we try to stop by for a drink before we head out on our mission to have a good time. i THINK this is the only place in the city that serves absinthe. the place is small but cozy. its more of a lounge than a bar... but the drinks are fantastic and the people there are nice. when you order absinthe, the owner is the only one that whips it up. its quite the attention getter when hes making the shots. flames and sugar and many cups just amazes people around you. quite the conversation starter. this place rocks! BTW, dont order absinthe when there are alot of ppl at the bar because it does take up quite a bit of time to make this concoction.
author: Sam L.

description: i used to come here a lot back in the day when i used to spin records here. some friends of mine used to run the place and then something strange happened. they got tha boot! i've only been back once since then - and that was over a year ago. the place is strange. it could be a cool space, but last time i was there, they had these weird plants and bean bag chairs ... i just think that decor doesn't really go with the atmosphere. the location is also way out of the way. the only reason i'd ever go back here is if i'm stranded in that neighborhood and every bar in town is closed and my life depended on continuing to drink until i was completely sloshed. i'm definately not a fan of this place.
author: James J.

description: in a realitively clean part of the fidi sits EZ5. i had never ever heard of it until my roommie took me there with her coworkers. i was surprised to see a full on spread of food sitting out for happy hour. spring rolls, potstickers, edamame, i was left wondering "what the hell?". well, i was informed that the bar was owned by "mama", a chinese grandma lookin lady with a lot of life left in her. mama was a friendly woman sporting an EZ5 logo tank top and working the crowd. it was pretty impressive. the waitresses are hilarious as well and probably feed off of mama's energy. a dj plays in the background not loud enough to where you have to shout to be heard, but just loud enough so when you are drunk you can start shaking your ass in the middle of this small space. yes, its a small space so get there early and snag yourself a sofa. order a car bomb and relax at the EZ5
author: Aly L.

description: I's a pretty good bar to go to after work.  The staff is very friendly and it's not to crowded usually aroung 4-5 when I like to go.  they also i guess have a pretty good selection of ap
author: Anthony Y.

description: nice comfy bar. never seems to be really packed. great place for a large group to go and kick it. and they serve a wicked car bomb.
author: Dean E.
